title: Buhari seeks indefinite extension of medical vacation from Senate - NAIJ.COM
text: The Nigerian Senate has confirmed receiving a letter from President Muhammadu Buhari for an extension of his medical leave from 10 days. President Buhari is in the UK on medical leave The Senate however said the president wanted an indefinite extension of vacation in UK. READ ALSO: Femi Adesina says he has no direct contact with Buhari in UK Confirming the latest on the president on Tuesday, February 7, Senator Aliyu Sabi, spokesperson for the upper legislative chamber said the president did not specify when he would return. “We are also in receipt of a second letter informing us that he is extending his vacation because in the course of the routine checkup, his doctors recommended more checkups,” Premium Times quoted him as saying. He said the Senate would look at the letter when it resumes on February 21 and urged Nigerians to be patient with the government as it makes efforts to resolve the country’s challenges. Since President Buhari left Nigeria on vacation, the vice president of the country, Professor Yemi Osinbajo, has carried on with governmental activities including holding Federal Executive Council (FEC) meetings.
